intro: Angiopteris hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's water fern, is a species of fern native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Marsileaceae and is characterized by its aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit. The plant has delicate, floating leaves that are divided into small, rounded lobes. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in tropical wetland ecosystems.
